question: In mid-September I began to experience a numbing sensation in my right foot, and then the same sensation beginning the palm of my right hand and extending to my fingers.  Not long after, experienced the same sequence of events with my left foot and hand.  No pain, no tingling – just a numbness.Over the past couple of months, the situation has steadily worsened to the extent that it’s now affecting my ability to walk and to use my fingers for simple everyday tasks.  The fingers “feel” swollen, and appear swollen and the pads of fingertips are smooth and no longer provide any traction for picking up an object, buttoning a garment, zipping a zipper, etc.    Feet the same at balls of feet, toes and heels.  Tried a diuretic in that the sensation felt like edema.  Did not alleviate the problem.When I look at my face in the mirror, it appears there has been a slackening of my right eyelid and right cheek.  Also, overall, it seems my right side had been a bit more severely affected than my left.  Also experiencing a blotchy facial rash that peals like a patch of dry skin or a sunburn might.So far, I am told blood work has ruled out:  diabetes, scleroderma, raynauds, lyme disease, osteoarthritis, MS.  Disc problem has been ruled out because this has presented on both sides of my body instead of just one.One physician said I have advanced autonomic disorder and recommended 600 mg of alpha lipoic acid.  The other has recommended a  consultation with a neurologist, which I have had scheduled for next week.  Any further testing may have to wait until January, as I’m told it could run into the thousand dollar range.If any of this sounds familiar, or if you have any recommendations on following up with my neurologists appointment, I’d appreciate you sharing your thoughts.
title: HELP -- Ideas as to why hands and feet numbing out
